original: Theravāda Vinaya
analyzed: thera vāda vinaya
translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders

original: Mahāvibhaṅga🔽Pācittiyakaṇḍa🔽Sahadhammikavagga
analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  pācittiyakaṇḍa  sahadhammika vagga
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on offenses entailing confession

original: 81. Dubbalasikkhāpada
analyzed: dubbala sikkhāpada
translated: The sub-chapter on legitimate🔽The training rule on the weak,

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the Squirrel Sanctuary,

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā dabbo mallaputto saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapeti bhattāni ca uddisati.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā dabbaḥ malla putto saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapeti bhattāni ca uddisati
translated: the Venerable Dabba the Mallian was assigning the dwellings and distributing the meals.

original: So cāyasmā dubbalacīvaro hoti.
analyzed: saḥ ca ayasmai dubbala cīvaraḥ hoti
translated: He was short of robes.

original: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa ekaṁ cīvaraṁ uppannaṁ hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa ekam cīvaram uppannam hoti
translated: At that time a robe had been offered to the Sangha.

original: Atha kho saṅgho taṁ cīvaraṁ āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa adāsi.
analyzed: atha kho saṅghaḥ tam cīvaram āyasmataḥ dabbassa malla puttassa adāsi
translated: The Sangha gave it to Dabba.

original: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks from the group of six complained and criticized him,

original: “yathāsanthutaṁ bhikkhū saṅghikaṁ lābhaṁ pariṇāmentī”ti.
analyzed: yathāsanthutam bhikkhū saṅghikam lābham pariṇāmenti iti
translated: “The monks are misappropriating the Sangha’s robe-cloth.”

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires, who had a sense of conscience, … criticized him,

original: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṁ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṁ āpajjissantī”ti …pe…
analyzed: katham hi nāma chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū samaggena saṅghena cīvaram datvā pacchā khīyana dhammaṃ āpajjissanti iti pe
translated: “How could the monks from the group of six give a robe to Dabba after it had been legitimately given to the Sangha, and then criticize him?” …🔽“Is it true, monks, that you did this?” …🔽“Foolish men, how could you do this? This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …

original: “saccaṁ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṁ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṁ āpajjathā”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira tumhe bhikkhave samaggena saṅghena cīvaram da tvā pacchā khīyana dhammam āpajjatha ati
translated: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān pe
translated: The Buddha rebuked them …

original: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṁ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṁ āpajjissatha.
analyzed: katham hi nāma tumhe mogha purisāḥ samaggena saṅghena cīvaram da tvā pacchā khīyana dhammaṃ āpajjissatha
translated: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

original: Netaṁ, moghapurisā, appasannānaṁ, vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: neta moghapurisāḥ appasannāna vā pasādāya pe
translated: This neither inspires faith in the faithless …”

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

original: “Yo pana bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṁ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṁ āpajjeyya ‘yathāsanthutaṁ bhikkhū saṅghikaṁ lābhaṁ pariṇāmentī’ti, pācittiyan”ti.🔽Yo panāti🔽yo yādiso …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ pana bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena cīvaram datvā pacchā khīyana dhammam āpajjeyya yathāsanthutam bhikkhū saṅghikam lābham pariṇāmenti iti pācittiyanti  yaḥ panāti  yaḥ ya ādisaḥ pe
translated: ‘If a monk gives a robe to a unanimous Sangha and then complains about it, saying, “The monks are misusing the Sangha’s material gifts,” he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: bhikkhūti
analyzed: bhikkhū ti
translated: If a monk:

original: …pe… ayaṁ imasmiṁ atthe adhippeto bhikkhūti.
analyzed: pe ayam imasmin atthe adhippetaḥ bhikkhu iti
translated: if he is called “monk”, “the one with shaven head”, “the one with shaven face”, “the one with the copper bowl”, “the one with the ochre robe”, “the one with matted hair”, “the one with topknot”, “the one with long hair”, “the one with the tonsure”, “the one with the going forth”, “the one with the higher ordination”, “the one who has entered the monastic life”, “the one who has taken up the monastic life”, “the one who has taken refuge in the Buddha”, “the one who has taken up the ascetic life”, “the one who has taken up the spiritual life”, “the one who has taken up the monastic life”, “the one who has taken up the life of homelessness”, “the one who has taken up the life of a monastic”, “the one who has taken up the life of a wanderer”, “the one who has taken up the life of a monk’, then for that reason he is called a “monk”.🔽A unanimous Sangha:

original: Samaggo nāma saṅgho🔽samānasaṁvāsako samānasīmāyaṁ ṭhito.
analyzed: samaggaḥ nāma saṅghaḥ  samāna sa vāsakaḥ samāna sīmāyam ṭhitaḥ
translated: a complete Sangha.

original: Cīvaraṁ nāma
analyzed: cīvaram nāma
translated: A robe:

original: channaṁ cīvarānaṁ aññataraṁ cīvaraṁ vikappanupagaṁ pacchimaṁ.
analyzed: channam cīvarānam aññataram cīvaram vikappana upagam pacchima
translated: any one of the six kinds of robe-cloth that is allowable to be assigned.

original: Datvāti
analyzed: da tvā iti
translated: Given:

original: sayaṁ datvā.
analyzed: sayam da tvā
translated: given by oneself.

original: Yathāsanthutaṁ nāma🔽yathāmittatā yathāsandiṭṭhatā yathāsambhattatā yathāsamānupajjhāyakatā yathāsamānācariyakatā.
analyzed: yathāsanthutam nāma  yathā mitta tā yathā sandiṭṭha tā yathā sambhatta tā yathā samāna upajjhāyaka tā yathā samāna ācariyaka tā
translated: What is suitable to the owners:

original: Saṅghikaṁ nāma
analyzed: saṅghikam nāma
translated: what is suitable to friends, what is suitable to acquaintances, what is suitable to relatives, what is suitable to pupils, what is suitable to co-pupils, what is suitable to teachers, what is suitable to co-teachers.🔽Belonging to the Sangha:

original: saṅghassa dinnaṁ hoti pariccattaṁ.
analyzed: saṅghassa dinnam hoti pariccatta
translated: given and assigned to the Sangha.

original: Lābho nāma
analyzed: lābhaḥ nāma
translated: Gain:

original: cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārā, antamaso cuṇṇapiṇḍopi, dantakaṭṭhampi, dasikasuttampi.
analyzed: cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārāḥ antamasaḥ cuṇṇa piṇḍaḥ api danta kaṭṭham pi dasika suttam pi
translated: robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies, even as little as a needle or thread; tooth cleaners; or a piece of string.

original: Pacchā khīyanadhammaṁ āpajjeyyāti🔽upasampannassa saṅghena sammatassa senāsanapaññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa vā yāgubhājakassa
analyzed: pacchā khīyana dhammaṃ āpajjeyya ati  upasampannassa saṅghena sammatassa senāsana paññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa vā yāgubhājakassa
translated: If, after giving it, she criticizes it:

original: vā phalabhājakassa vā khajjabhājakassa vā appamattakavissajjakassa vā cīvaraṁ dinne🔽khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: vā phala bhājakassa vā khajja bhājakassa vā appamattaka vissajjakassa vā cīvaram dinne  khiyyati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: if, after giving robe-cloth to a monk who is agreed upon by the Sangha as the assigner of dwellings, the server of meals, the distributor of rice porridge, the distributor of fruit, the distributor of fresh foods, or the distributor of minor requisites, she criticizes it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī cīvaraṁ dinne khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: dhamma kamme dhamma kamma saññī cīvaram dinne khiyyati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she criticizes it after giving robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Dhammakamme vematiko cīvaraṁ dinne khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: dhamma kamme vematikaḥ cīvaram dinne khiyyati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If he is unsure of the legitimacy of the legal procedure, and he complains after the robe-cloth has been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī cīvaraṁ dinne khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: dhamma kamme adhamma kamma saññī cīvaram dinne khiyyati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If the legal procedure is legitimate, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he complains after the robe-cloth has been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Aññaṁ parikkhāraṁ dinne khiyyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Upasampannassa saṅghena asammatassa senāsanapaññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa vā yāgubhājakassa
analyzed: aññam parikkhāram dinne khiyyati āpatti dukkaṭassa  upasampannassa saṅghena a sammatassa senāsana paññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa vā yāgubhājakassa
translated: If he complains after other requisites have been given, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: vā phalabhājakassa vā khajjabhājakassa vā appamattakavissajjakassa vā cīvaraṁ vā🔽aññaṁ vā parikkhāraṁ dinne khiyyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: vā phala bhājakassa vā khajja bhājakassa vā appamattaka vissajjakassa vā cīvaram vā  aññam vā parikkhāram dinne khiyyati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If he complains after robe-cloth or other requisites have been given by a monk who has not been appointed by the Sangha to be the assigner of dwellings, the designator of meals, the distributor of conjey, the distributor of fruit, the distributor of fresh foods, or the distributor of minor requisites, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Anupasampannassa saṅghena sammatassa vā asammatassa vā senāsanapaññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa🔽vā yāgubhājakassa vā phalabhājakassa vā khajjabhājakassa vā appamattakavissajjakassa
analyzed: an upasampannassa saṅghena sammatassa vā a sammatassa vā senāsana paññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa  vā yāgu bhājakassa vā phala bhājakassa vā khajja bhājakassa vā appamattaka vissajjakassa
translated: If he complains after robe-cloth or other requisites have been given by a monk who has been appointed by the Sangha to be the assigner of dwellings, the designator of meals, the distributor of conjey, the distributor of fruit, the distributor of fresh foods, or the distributor of minor requisites, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: vā cīvaraṁ vā aññaṁ vā parikkhāraṁ dinne khiyyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: vā cīvaram vā aññam vā parikkhāram dinne khiyyati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If he complains after robe-cloth or other requisites have been given by one who is not fully ordained, whether or not he has been appointed to be the assigner of dwellings, the designator of meals, the distributor of conjey, the distributor of fruit, the distributor of fresh foods, or the distributor of minor requisites, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Adhammakamme dhammakammasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Adhammakamme vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: adhamma kamme dhamma kamma saññī āpatti dukkaṭassa  adhamma kamme vematikaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Adhammakamme adhammakammasaññī, anāpatti.
analyzed: adhamma kamme adhamma kamma saññī anāpatti
translated: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

original: Anāpatti—
analyzed: anāpatti
translated: There is no offense if

original: pakatiyā chandā dosā mohā bhayā karontaṁ “kvattho tassa dinnena laddhāpi vinipātessati na sammā upanessatī”ti khiyyati,
analyzed: pakatiyā chandā dosā mohā bhayā karontam kvattho tassa dinnena laddhā api vinipātessati na sammā upanessati iti khiyyati
translated: he criticizes one who is acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, thinking, “Whatever he gives will be lost and not well-used;”

original: ummattakassa,
analyzed: ummattakassa
translated: if he is insane;

original: ādikammikassāti.🔽Dubbalasikkhāpadaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ ekādasamaṁ.
analyzed: ādikammikassa ati 🔽dubbala sikkhāpadam niṭṭhitam ekādasama
translated: if he is the first offender.🔽The training rule on the weak, the eleventh, is finished.
